Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Novel Disposable Leukocyte Remover in Cardiopulmonary Bypass

Trial_Design.evidence: This substudy within a registered clinical trial (NCT05400356) involved seven patients undergoing CPB at West China Hospital, Sichuan University.

Participants.evidence: seven patients undergoing CPB at West China Hospital, Sichuan University.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was a disposable leukocyte remover with an RGD peptide-coated membrane, integrated into an extracorporeal circuit.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates a novel leukocyte remover to mitigate these effects.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in activated neutrophils, measured over 10 minutes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Neutrophil counts and those expressing CD11b, CD54, CD64, or CD181 decreased by 36–39% within 2.5 minutes, with slower declines thereafter.

Harms.evidence: No significant changes in leukocyte morphology were observed.
